title: Identify known quantities
text: There are three known quantities, $$3.6$$ $$h$$, $$4$$ $$h$$ and $$5$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$.
speech: There are three known quantities,  3.6   h ,  4   h  and  5  , fraction, m i, over h,  .

title: Determine unknown quantities
text: There are four unknown quantities, the speed Jennifer drives on Saturday, the speed she drives on Sunday, the distance she drives on Saturday and Sunday.
speech: There are four unknown quantities, the speed Jennifer drives on Saturday, the speed she drives on Sunday, the distance she drives on Saturday and Sunday.

title: Assign a variable
text: In this question, there are more than one unknown quantities, we need to choose one, for example, the speed Jennifer drives on Saturday and let it equal $$r$$.

title: Express other quantities
text: If the speed Jennifer drives on Satuday is $$r$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$ and her speed is $$5$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$ slower on Sunday than on Saturday, what is her speed on Sunday?

title: Translation to Math Operations
text: The only thing we can translate into an equation is the distance between Jennifer and her mother's house remains unchanged.

title: Explain the solution
text: Jennifer' speed is $$50$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$ on Saturday and $$45$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$ on Sunday.
